Package rubank

Class TransactionManagerController

java.lang.Object
pizzapizza.PapasPizzeriaController
public class TransactionManagerController extends Object
The controller class for Transaction Manager, defining functionalities for all buttons and Text Fields on the GUI
Author:
Sibi suriyanarayan Tiruchirapalli venketaramani, Rahulraj Rajesh

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionManagerController

      public TransactionManagerController()

  • Method Details

    • handleActions

      void handleActions()
      This method takes both the ccClicked() and the smmClicked() method so that we can pass in one action to SceneBuilder

    • ccClicked

      void ccClicked()
      This method enables the campus buttons, NB, Newark, Camden if the account is College Checking It disables it if the account is of another type

    • smmClicked

      void smmClicked()
      This method enables the Loyal Customer button, lc, if the account is Savings or MoneyMarket It disables it if the account is of another type

    • emptyCheck

      String emptyCheck()
      Check for empty fields during the creation of an account type. This method checks the input fields for the account registration, including the First Name, Last Name, Date of Birth, and the selection of an account type. It ensures that all required fields are filled, and at least one account type is selected.
      Returns:
      A descriptive error message if any of the checks fail, or an empty string if all fields and selections are valid.

    • findingDuplicateChecking

      boolean findingDuplicateChecking(Account a)
      Checks for the presence of a Checking Account for a user who already has a College Checking account and vice versa This method checks for the presence of an account of the other type between Checking and College Checking in the account database. It compares the provided account with existing accounts and ensures that there is no account with the same details but the other type.
      Parameters:
      a - The account to be checked.
      Returns:
      `true` if a duplicate account of the other type is found, `false` otherwise.

    • open

      void open()
      Open a new account based on user input and add it to the account database. This method opens a new account based on user input and adds it to the account database. It performs various checks, such as validating input fields, ensuring a minimum balance, checking for duplicate accounts, and making sure account requirements are met. If the input and checks are successful, the account is added to the database, and a success message is displayed. If any checks fail or invalid input is detected, the code displays error messages.

    • close

      void close()
      Close an account based on user input and remove it from the account database. This method allows the user to close an existing account based on input provided, and then removes the account from the account database if it is present. It performs various checks, such as validating input fields, verifying account existence, and handling the closure of different account types. If the input and checks are successful, the account is closed, and a success message is displayed. If any checks fail or invalid input is detected, error messages are displayed.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clear the input fields, selections, and message area. This method clears the input fields, selections, and message area in the GUI. It provides a way to reset the input sections, removing any previous input and messages.

    • dwEmpty

      boolean dwEmpty()
      Check for empty fields in the deposit/withdraw tab. This method checks for empty fields and selections in the deposit/withdraw tab. It verifies whether all required fields, such as First Name, Last Name, Date of Birth, Account Type, and Balance, are filled. If any field is empty or not selected, an error message is appended to the message area.
      Returns:
      `true` if any required field is empty or not selected, `false` otherwise.

    • deposit

      void deposit()
      Perform a deposit into an account based on user input and update the account's balance. This method allows the user to perform a deposit into an existing account based on the provided input. It performs various checks, such as validating input fields, verifying account existence, and handling the deposit for different account types. If the input and checks are successful, the account's balance is updated, and a success message is displayed. If any checks fail or invalid input is detected, error messages are displayed.

    • withdraw

      void withdraw()
      Perform a withdrawal from an account based on user input and update the account's balance. This method allows the user to perform a withdrawal from an existing account based on the provided input. It performs various checks, such as validating input fields, verifying account existence, and handling the withdrawal for different account types. If the input and checks are successful, the account's balance is updated, and a success message is displayed. If any checks fail, the account has insufficient funds, or invalid input is detected, appropriate error messages are displayed.

    • print

      void print()
      Print and display the sorted account information in the message area. This method retrieves a sorted list of account information from the account database and displays it in the message area. The account information includes details about account holders, types, and balances. The information is displayed in the order determined by the sorting algorithm applied to the accounts in the database.

    • printF

      void printF()
      Print and display the fees and interest information for accounts in the message area. This method retrieves information about fees and interest accrued by accounts in the account database and displays it in the message area. The information includes details about account fees and interest earned based on the account types and balances. The data is displayed for each account in the database.

    • printU

      void printU()
      Print and display updated account balances in the message area. This method retrieves information about updated account balances from the account database and displays it in the message area. The information includes the latest balances for each account in the database, considering deposits, withdrawals, fees, and interest accrual.

    • fileRead

      void fileRead()
      Read account data from a selected text file and populate the account database. This method allows the user to select a text file containing account information and reads the data from the file. It processes the data to create and populate accounts in the account database. The file should be formatted with account information separated by commas. It performs various checks on the data, including validation of account information and checking for duplicate accounts. If the input data is valid and no issues are encountered, the accounts are added to the database, and a success message is displayed. If any checks fail, error messages are displayed.
